725123f-a.text:
21st Street, east side, at 24th Drive (vantage point). The view is southeastward across the lot bounded by 21st and 23rd Streets and 24th Drive and 25th Avenue. In the center background are the rears of homes fronting on the west side of 24th Street. The lone 2-story house facing the observer is on the east side of 23rd Street. Local youngsters use this place as a ball field.
P. L. Sperr  March 11, 1931

725138f-a.text:
24th Drive, west from 21st Street. The shack in the foreground is a renting office for newly erected
dwellings.
P. L. Sperr  March 11, 1931

726912f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue, west from 23rd Street and across 21st Street, toward the East River. On the right is Astoria Park. In the
background is Manhattan.
P. L. Sperr  July 25, 1936

725118f-a.text:
21st Street, east side, between Hoyt Avenue and 25th Road, showing two old homes. 21st Street, here, was formerly known as Van Alst Avenue.
P. L. Sperr  June 12, 1935

725119f-a.text:
21st Street, at the N.W. corner of Hoyt (25th) Avenue. The buildings are being demolished for the construction of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge.
P. L. Sperr  May 27, 1934
